intro: Pseudognaphalium robustum, commonly known as the robust hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with dense, hairy stems and basal rosettes of leaves. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in clusters, producing numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. Pseudognaphalium robustum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
